## Project-Specific Cost of Capital

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

rf <- 0.03
beta_project <- rnorm(1, mean = 1.2, sd = 0.1)
rm <- 0.09
```

Aurora Technologies is evaluating a project with beta **`r round(beta_project,2)`**. Assume the risk-free rate is **`r round(rf*100,2)`**% and the expected market return is **`r round(rm*100,2)`**%.

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display:flex;flex-direction:row;gap:6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q13a"><strong>1. What is the project-specific cost of equity (in %)?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q13a" name="module4_num_q13a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width:150px;"
    data-correct-answer=`r round((rf + beta_project*(rm-rf))*100,2)` data-tolerance="0.01"/>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q13a" class="feedback" style="display:none;">
✅ Cost of equity (CAPM for project) = r_f + β_project (r_m − r_f) = **`r round((rf + beta_project*(rm-rf))*100,2)`**%.
</div>

:::
